comments:
Introduction to the integration of biomedical engineering in clinical medicine through lectures and a preceptorship with clinical faculty.

Students overall found the course “an excellent experience” and “a great opportunity.” However, a few students felt the course experience had “some inconsistencies across preceptorships.”

Several students enjoyed the “unique and interesting” guest speakers, and had mentors that were “kind” and the preceptorships “were well worth it.” However, some students were disappointed “not all preceptors are practicing physicians.”

Students commented that this course was a “time commitment” with “a few papers,” a requirement to “shadow your preceptor,” and a final presentation.  Students overall highly recommended the course for BE students.  This course is for BE majors ONLY, with preference given to BSE students.
